ChunkText: keep track of your unemployment days students are granted an additional 60 unemployment days on stem opt. this will be added to the number of unemployment days you did not use during regular opt.
ContextBefore: follow these regulations: update your address and any employer information within 10 days of the change do not delete any employers this is for record keeping to update your employer information, submit a stem OPT employment update request work in paid positions for at least 20 hoursweek for each employer must be related to your major program of study can be multiple employers, but must work at least 20 hoursweek in each job neither part-time work less than 20 hours per week nor unpaid work are permitted during stem opt!
ContextAfter: for example, if you did not use any unemployment days during regular opt, then you will have 90 leftover from regular OPT 60 added during stem OPT 150 total unemployment days available.
